availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James H. Terrell (Ballard County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Married to Lucy A. Terrell. Father of John A. Terrell, James R. Terrell, Mary E. Terrell, Thadius Terrell, Luellen Terrell, and Franklin Terrell. Farmer in Ballard County in 1850 and 1860. Owned one enslaved person in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, p. 288. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Tharps, p. 136. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Tharps District, p. 15. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, District 2, p. 23. Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Morality Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, p. 1.
